items.title: NSW Police response to Lindy Lucena's fatal bashing to be probed by watchdog
items.summary: The independent body in charge of overseeing NSW Police misconduct allegations will today probe the response to Lindy Lucena's fatal bashing in 2023.

items.title: Australia's longest-running radio show celebrates 80 years of rural storytelling

items.title: Israel wants buffer zone between occupied Golan Heights and Damascus in peace with Syria

items.title: Proton therapy cancer unit debacle leads to $US32 million lawsuit

items.summary: The Australian Telecommunications and Media Authority says scammers were able to manipulate the telco's systems to bypass required identity verification processes.

items.summary: Ballarat Gold Mine has exceeded national standards for potentially dangerous air pollutants.

items.summary: The last time Australia played a Test with the pink ball, the brilliance of Mitchell Starc and Scott Boland turned the game into a farce.

items.summary: MPs in the United Kingdom will investigate the Crown Estate, after revelations Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor — Queen Elizabeth II's second son — had not paid rent for two decades sparked outrage.

items.title: Sensitive parliament communications handed to contractor without security clearance
items.summary: The team of a contractor that was the victim of a Russia-linked hack did not have the necessary security clearance when it received thousands of sensitive communications between politicians and parliamentary staff, in a mistake the department has now conceded.

items.title: Meningococcal B scare prompts call for free immunisation program
items.summary: Charlie was in a coma for days after contracting the rare but preventable disease. He was lucky to survive.

items.title: Christmas Island's last dog embraced by the remote community
items.summary: Dogs were banned some years ago to protect the unique wildlife of Christmas Island, but one very special chocolate Labrador remains, and she is shared by the whole community.

items.title: Energy grid not ready for Eraring coal plant's closure, AEMO says
items.summary: The energy grid is not ready for the closure of the Eraring coal plant, the energy operator has warned, raising the threat of widespread blackouts in eastern Australia.

items.title: Rubio says Ukraine talks in US productive but work remains to find peace deal
items.summary: Marco Rubio says he expects the talks between US and Ukrainian officials on Sunday about finding a peace deal with Russia to yield progress in ending the war.

items.title: Eight ways to drink less during Christmas party season
items.summary: If you want to drink less (or not at all) this silly season, you don't have to rely on willpower alone. Having a plan can help.

items.title: Opticomm customers across Australia losing free-to-air television and facing internet outages
items.summary: About 50,000 Australians are set to lose access to free-to-air television using their existing technology. And the troubles do not end there, with many customers also reporting regular and prolonged internet outages.

items.title: Thousands of Australians losing free-to-air tv access and facing internet outages
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Big haul of 170yo Indigenous artefacts unearthed in North West Queensland
items.summary: A stash of Aboriginal artefacts, dating back about 170 years, is unearthed from the red dirt of outback Queensland, bringing history to life for the local Pitta Pitta people.

items.title: Australia humbled by New Zealand in Dubai rugby sevens finals
items.summary: Australia falls to its trans-Tasman rivals in both the women's and men's finals at the season-opening leg of the world series.

items.title: The Macquarie Point stadium decision is due this week — here's how it could play out
items.summary: The long-running debate over whether an AFL stadium should be built on Hobart's waterfront is reaching an end, as the parliamentary vote takes place this week.

items.title: Australia's Travis Head prepared to play any role in day-night Ashes Test against England
items.summary: Travis Head says he has no qualms if he is shifted back down Australia's batting order following his exploits as an opener in the first Ashes Test.

items.title: Lebanese hopeful Pope Leo will bring peace as he visits the country
items.summary: As Pope Leo visits Lebanon, many locals hope he will bring peace to the region, viewing the visit as a message of solidarity.

items.title: Hinchinbrook by-election a tick of approval for LNP government but no crystal ball for outcome of next election
items.summary: A week is a long time in politics, let alone three years, and the LNP's success at the next election is by no means assured, writes Jack McKay.

items.title: Dicky Bill salad farms enter administration with 180 job cuts before Christmas
items.summary: Australian salad grower Dicky Bill enters administration, putting 180 people out of work before Christmas.

items.title: Italian-Australian glass artist takes her work from Carnarvon to Venice
items.summary: Sabrina's father warned her she couldn't make a living from art, but after decades in a sensible job she's now making waves in the world of glass art.

items.title: Incoming Australian social media ban leaves children vulnerable to phishing scams, experts say
items.summary: As the social media ban comes into effect, experts are worried children and families will be left vulnerable to age verification scams. Here's why.

items.title: England's Ashes demolition job of Australia in Brisbane's first ever cricket Test match at the Ekka
items.summary: Australia's Ashes domination in Brisbane is almost total, with England winless at the Gabba since 1986. It wasn't always like this though, with the first visit to Brisbane resulting in the heaviest defeat in cricket history.

items.title: Tech companies advised to label and 'watermark' AI-generated content
items.summary: With AI deepfakes causing confusion and harm online, the federal government tells tech developers that AI content should be clearly labelled, ahead of a National AI Plan due to be released.

items.title: Early Childhood Education Minister Jess Walsh would not commit to a childcare inquiry despite growing safety concerns.
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: This week in history quiz: Can you ace our test on events from the past?
items.summary: From reality TV and heist movie remakes to man's last step on the Moon — how well do you know this week in history?

items.title: Albanese reached his zenith in 2025, but 2026 could test the limits of Labor's power
items.summary: It is hard to imagine a better end to the prime minister's year than this one, but realists in government know Labor can't continue to ride the wave.

items.title: Weight loss drugs are rewriting the global business of how we eat
items.summary: The explosive rise of drugs like Ozempic and Mounjaro is shifting consumption patterns, health outcomes and pushing pharmaceutical giants into trillion-dollar valuations.

items.title: Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu formally asks to be pardoned from corruption charges
items.summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has formally asked for a pardon from President Isaac Herzog relating to corruption charges against him.

items.title: Ellyse Perry stars as Sixers claim Sydney Smash honours, Strikers down Heat
items.summary: Australia star Ellyse Perry hits an unbeaten 77 as the Sixers down the Thunder by six wickets in the Sydney Smash.

items.title: Ukraine hits two Russian 'shadow fleet' oil tankers with naval drones in the Black Sea
items.summary: Naval drones could be seen speeding towards hulking tankers followed by powerful explosions that caused fires on the vessels.

items.title: Shipping movements disrupted as climate change protesters block coal ships from entering Port of Newcastle
items.summary: Police arrest 141 people in Newcastle Harbour for alleged marine-related offences during an anti-fossil fuel protest that began on Thursday.

items.title: Photographer Lyn Alcock captures wild antics of Dryandra's numbat population over 20 years
items.summary: Lyn Alcock is known as the 'Numbat whisperer', spending hours every day observing and photographing the tiny, endangered marsupials, recording behaviours that have never been seen before.

items.title: Em Rusciano on finding balance in life after her ADHD and autism diagnoses
items.summary: As a writer, singer, comedian, podcaster, author and single mum, Em Rusciano has become accustomed to navigating a chaotic life. The self-described "maximalist power queen" shares how she unwinds and how her approach to life has changed since going through perimenopause and being diagnosed with ADHD and autism.

items.title: Tasmania Police searching King Island for missing local teenager Lusian West
items.summary: Local King Island teen Lusian West, 16, has not been seen since Friday, with Tasmania police and rescue crews to conduct aerial searches of the island's north.

items.title: Carbon dioxide import plan could see Darwin become world's climate pollution 'dumping ground', say activists
items.summary: A plan for the Northern Territory to be among the first places in the world to import foreign carbon emissions has raised fears it will turn Darwin into a global pollution dumping ground.

items.title: LNP's Wayde Chiesa promises to get to work after victory in Hinchinbrook by-election
items.summary: The LNP's Wayde Chiesa will be the next representative for the Queensland seat of Hinchinbrook, which had been safely held by Katter's Australian Party since 2017.

items.title: How the Kangaroos beat the Lions to claim back-to-back AFLW flags in their perfect season
items.summary: Creating history by winning consecutive premierships and completing an unbeaten season is just reward for North Melbourne's boundary-pushing AFLW program.

items.title: Supporters of proposed Macquarie Point stadium rally ahead of crucial vote
items.summary: Supporters of Tasmania's proposed AFL stadium have gathered on Hobart's parliament lawns on Sunday to show their backing of the controversial build.

items.title: Sydney FC great Alex Brosque fumes over alleged handball in Wanderers' 1-0 ALM win
items.summary: Sydney FC's four-match winning streak comes to a crashing halt, but its 1-0 loss to Western Sydney has sparked debate about what constitutes a handball.

items.title: The Austrian heiress giving away her entire fortune
items.summary: When Marlene Engelhorn inherited tens of millions of dollars from her grandma, she felt she had two choices: do something about it, or confirm she was "full of sh*t".

items.title: Surfers Paradise sand 'island' to disappear by Christmas
items.summary: Curious beachgoers are being cautioned to stay off the sandbar and to swim between the flags.

items.title: Energy independence? It would reduce the impact of global energy shocks
items.summary: If Australia produced 100 per cent of its energy from renewable sources, it would reduce the impact of global energy shocks on Australia's economy.

items.title: Surfers set to pay to ride Fiji's world-class breaks after repeal of surf access law
items.summary: Surfers wanting to catch a wave at Fiji's world class reef breaks could soon have to pay for the privilege after the repeal of a beach access law.

items.title: Indonesia flood death toll climbs amid cyclone devastation
items.summary: Torrential rain causes flash floods and landslides in Indonesia, where the toll rises as authorities mount rescue operations.

items.title: Eli Katoa shares images post brain surgery, pays tribute to partner and hopes for NRL return
items.summary: Melbourne Storm star Eli Katoa shares an update after his brain surgery, posting images of himself in hospital and saying he hopes to return to football "soon".

items.title: Queensland to become first Australian jurisdiction to allow specialist general practitioners to diagnose ADHD in adults
items.summary: Queensland is becoming the first jurisdiction in Australia to allow specialist GPs to diagnose ADHD in adults and prescribe treatment, but some hold concerns about the lack of mandatory specific training.

items.title: British playwright and Oscar winner Tom Stoppard dies at 88
items.summary: Stoppard was often hailed as the greatest British playwright of his generation, with multiple awards for his work on stage and screen.

items.title: Sterile flies rain down on Kangaroo Island as battle to wipe out sheep blowfly gets serious
items.summary: Researchers on Kangaroo Island have been breeding and releasing millions of sterile Australian sheep blowflies in an attempt to eradicate the pest.

items.title: North Melbourne Kangaroos rally around injured Mia King after AFLW grand final
items.summary: During their AFLW premiership celebrations, North Melbourne players make sure to take time for Mia King, who just missed the grand final with a knee injury.

items.title: Marco Rubio, Steve Witkoff to meet Ukraine delegation in Florida, US official says
items.summary: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio and special envoy Steve Witkoff will meet with Ukrainian negotiators in Florida for talks on a deal to end Russia's war in Ukraine, a senior US official says.

items.title: What people with diabetes want you to know
items.summary: We spoke to six people with three different types of diabetes to find out what they wish more of the public knew. Here's what they had to say.

items.title: Labor should theoretically be confident ahead of the 2026 Victorian election — but challenges are mounting
items.summary: On paper, Labor should be confident that it will score an unprecedented fourth term in office when Victorian voters go to the ballot box in a year's time, with the Liberal opposition still scrambling to present as an electable alternative.

items.title: 'Awareness gap' on mental health support available for new parents
items.summary: Nilupulie Karunaratne thought asking for help was a sign of weakness. Then her husband referred her to a psychologist.

items.title: Paul Kelly, Stella Donnelly, 5 Seconds of Summer lead November's best new albums
items.summary: Sensitive song-smiths, reinvented boy bands, rock and rap upstarts — it's all here in an Ausmusic Month edition of the best new music.

items.title: Thai PM admits flood failures after trapped victims wait days for help
items.summary: Thailand’s Health Ministry estimates that more than 160 people were killed in the disaster across nine provinces, but at least 110 of those died in Songkhla, where Hat Yai is located.

items.title: The spooky First Nations movie you need to see at BIFF
items.summary: First Nations stories are combined with modern horror scares in this new film from Australian creatives Chris Broadbent and Enzo Tedeschi.

items.title: Hobart stadium vote will determine future of historic Macquarie Point waterfront and AFL team
items.summary: Since its inception, the stadium project has divided the Hobart community in a tug of war between development and preservation of its historic waterfront. In just days, the door will shut forever on one side of the debate.

items.title: Sex work influencers call out lack of transparency as young girls targeted by viral social media content
items.summary: Sex workers say viral social media content, which often promotes a life of luxury, needs to be more transparent to avoid duping young followers.

items.title: Crypto gaming earns users tokens but also exposes them to risks of trading and speculation
items.summary: As the crypto sector expands its appeal beyond tech insiders, the gamification of cryptocurrencies is appealing to younger users, which experts warn is walking the line between gaming and gambling.

items.title: Why Barbados became a republic and cut ties with the British monarchy
items.summary: With countries like Australia still debating whether or not the time has come to become a republic, what prompted tiny Barbados with its population of less than 300,000, to take the leap?

items.title: As questions around horse welfare grow, equestrian sport is facing a reckoning
items.summary: As questions around horse welfare grow, can equestrian sport's Olympic dream survive?

items.title: Trump says airspace above and surrounding Venezuela to be closed in its entirety
items.summary: US President Donald Trump says the entire airspace above the South American nation of Venezuela should be considered closed in its entirety.

items.title: Kangaroos break new ground on the field and in the history books in AFLW flag defence
items.summary: North Melbourne proves to be ground breakers and history makers as it extend its match-winning streak to 27 games in a comprehensive win over Brisbane.

items.title: Meg Lanning hits 73no as Stars down Renegades, Hurricanes defeat Scorchers
items.summary: Former Australia captain Meg Lanning hits 73 not out to help the Stars to a convincing 45-run derby victory over the Renegades, while the Hurricanes down the Scorchers.

items.title: Toni Lamond, known for her roles in Annie Get Your Gun and My Fair Lady, dies aged 93
items.summary: Australian screen and stage actor Toni Lamond was known for her roles in Annie Get Your Gun, My Fair Lady, Number 96 and The Last Frontier.

items.title: LNP claims victory in Hinchinbrook by-election
items.summary: The QLD Premier has declared an LNP win in the Hinchinbrook by-election, in what was once a Katter's Australian Party strong-hold.

items.title: North Melbourne becomes first AFLW team to win consecutive premierships after clinical grand final showing
items.summary: North Melbourne outclasses the Brisbane Lions by 40 points in the AFLW grand final to capture a history-making second consecutive premiership.

items.title: Police continue search for missing man Chris Thorne in Melbourne's west
items.summary: Police are searching for missing man Chris Thorne, who was last seen in Melbourne's western suburbs last week.
